galvanic adjective
(POWERFUL)
Add to word list
Add to word list
very sudden or noticeable, or causing shock, action, or excitement: When her character bursts into tears, the effect is galvanic. This ordinary couple had no idea of the galvanic changes their new son was about to bring to their lives.
More examplesFewer examplesHis choreography proved to have a galvanic effect on the dancers.There's one galvanic moment when the heroine pours out her grief. Audiences were reminded of his galvanic power as an actor in "The Godfather".

(ELECTRICAL)
electronics
